definition: to take over (from one another)/to alternate/to replace/to relay
more/even more/further/still/still more
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for

sentences.english: This is known as the replacement level.
For the moment, she could scarcely forgive the substitution.
sentences.chinese: 这会儿，她没法子宽恕这种更替。

sentences.english: The first book to analyse the history of the regime change from Qing Dynasty to Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第一本以科学手法解剖秦汉更替历史的通俗说史大书。

sentences.english: But trying to make sense of the heavens gave us more than the natural cycle of day and night.
sentences.chinese: 探究天空的欲望告诉我们的还不止日夜的自然更替。

sentences.english: Over the years the palace site has become the Weiyang residential district.
sentences.chinese: 岁月更替，宫殿遗址成为西安市未央区的一部分。

sentences.english: The UN projects that the world will reachreplacement fertility by 2030.
sentences.chinese: 联合国预计，到2030年，世界将达到更替生育率。

sentences.english: A good example of the shift is Iran.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗就是这种兴衰更替很好的例子。

sentences.english: Days and nights come up and go down with unfailing regularity, like the ebb and low of an infinite ocean.
sentences.chinese: 日月更替，亘古不变，就好比那无尽大海的潮涨潮落。

sentences.english: How has time, how has man, served these marvels?
sentences.chinese: 时光流逝，人事更替，这些稀世之宝终于成了什么呢？

sentences.english: We all know that markets go up and markets go down.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道市场繁荣和萧条更替。

sentences.english: But already the season is wavering and summer totters.
sentences.chinese: 季节正在更替，夏日已步履蹒跚。

sentences.english: The long and winding history of art brought along numerous - isms .
sentences.chinese: 艺术史的延绵更替造就了太多汗牛充栋的主义。

sentences.english: Season may change, winter to sping, I'll love you till the end.
sentences.chinese: 季节更替，冬去春来，我会爱你到底。

sentences.english: Days and nights pass and ages bloom and fade like flowers.
sentences.chinese: 日日夜夜，时代更替就像花开花落。

sentences.english: Take one strange familiar changes a passer-by b.
sentences.chinese: 轮流更替一个个陌生熟悉的路人甲乙。

sentences.english: Instead, in country afterdeveloped country, the fertility rate fell below replacement level.
sentences.chinese: 相反，一个个发达国家的生育率降到了更替水平以下。

changes/vicissitudes

rise and fall
prosperity and decline (of a kingdom)/rise and fall
to ebb and rise/to decrease and then grow
to decline/to die out/decline and fall
to flourish then decline/rise and fall

definition: changeable situation (idiom)
alternation of generations
to decline/to wane/to decay/to deteriorate
reform and renewal/generational change
to change/to fluctuate/change/fluctuation
as time goes by (idiom)
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
